alert.note: Alert for Litchfield (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 12:52AM EST until January 10 at 7:19PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, including the following county, Litchfield and east central New York, including the following county, Dutchess. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas and some small streams and creeks continues. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1249 AM EST, Rain and snowmelt continues to occur and is causing minor flooding. This will continue to cause urban flooding of low-lying and prone drainage areas as well as some small streams and creeks. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Torrington, Poughkeepsie, New Milford, Beacon, Saugerties, Rhinebeck, Pawling, Hyde Park, Pleasant Valley, Thomaston, New Hartford, Wappingers Falls, Amenia, Kent, Sharon, Highland, Pine Plains, Fishkill, Red Hook and Norfolk. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
